articles.title: Ancient Frog Fossil Changes Our Understanding of Australia's Evolution
articles.description: Discover how a 55-million-year-old frog fossil is reshaping our understanding of Australia's evolutionary history.
articles.content: A remarkable discovery has just redefined Australia’s frog evolution. A 55-million-year-old fossil, is rewriting our understanding of frog history, pushing back the timeline of Australian tree frogs by millions of years. This fossil, which is the old... [5263 chars]

articles.title: Rice University students develop vibration-vest to guide blind dogs navigate
articles.description: Rice University students have created a haptic vest for blind dogs, using cameras and vibrations to help pets navigate obstacles.
articles.content:
A team of Rice University engineering students has developed a high-tech vest to help blind dogs navigate their environments more safely and independently.

articles.title: Researchers from Calicut varsity develop cost-effective nanoclusters
articles.description: Cutting-edge LED technology using gold-copper alloy nanoclusters developed by University of Calicut researchers for sustainable lighting applications.
articles.content:
Researchers from the Department of Nanoscience and Technology at the University of Calicut have developed a novel device based on gold–copper alloy nanoclusters, a ground-breaking advancement in next-generation light-emitting diode (LED) technology.

articles.title: 2 Minnesota lawmakers shot in apparent 'targeted' incidents, in grave condition; manhunt underway
articles.description: Two Minnesota state lawmakers were shot in apparent "targeted" incidents on Saturday that left them in grave condition, officials said.
articles.content:
The shootings took place in Champlin and Brooklyn Park, Minnesota.
Minnesota State Representative Melissa Hortman and Minnesota State Senator John Hoffman are shown in these undated file photos.

articles.title: Two years on, Singapore's shift to preventive healthcare is bearing fruits - but what's holding it back from greater buy-in?
articles.description: More than a million Singaporeans and permanent residents aged 40 and above have signed up for Healthier SG, but not all have followed through with their health plans.
articles.content:
Several who spoke to CNA TODAY thought that the Healthier SG programme was akin to CHAS and Age Well SG, even though those are separate schemes with vastly different aims.

articles.description: Fresh James Webb Space Telescope images capture two young exoplanets in, providing new details about exoplanet atmospheres and formation.
